title: What is the advantages of DVD and CD? - Quora

response.answer_text: Over what? DVD were more durable than VHS. DVDs did not wear out with playing, or get tangled up in the player. DVDs don’t have tracking issues. DVDs have better video and audio. You could instantly seek to a new chapter, or ffwd/rev. VHS didn’t suffer from problems with getting scratched. That is the only advantage I can think of. CDs are superior in every way to cassette and vinyl from a usage, fidelity perspective. Vinyl was better for showing off the album art though! CDs being smaller didn’t have nearly as impressive album art, and album art probably became less important CDs and vinyl both scratch, but cassette tapes don’t scratch. Vinyl can warp badly if left in a hot car, etc. Cassette tapes rapidly degraded their audio quality with each play. Over time they become susceptible to jamming. CD is far superior in almost every way to cassette and vinyl. Reel to reel is maybe not as bad for wear as vinyl and cassette, but it’s hardly portable!

DVD and CD are usually used as external data storage devices. There are some common advantages of using DVD and CD as storage devices: Low priced storage devicesHave storage capacity of 700 MB (CD) and 4.7 G.B (DVD)Easily available in every store
